item.title: About Us
item.dc:creator: trx_admin
item.content:encoded: [vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1444643370093{margin-top: -60px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}"][vc_column][vc_empty_space height="85px"][trx_title type="2" align="center" bottom="40"]Welcome To The WineShop[/trx_title][trx_columns][trx_column_item][trx_block top="20" bottom="10"][trx_icon icon="icon-bottle-1" color="#b4bc5d" font_size="70px" align="left" bottom="20"][vc_column_text]We are a small family winery adhering to principles of quality wine making. We firmly believe that the wine we make is capable of competing with world famous brands. [/vc_column_text][/trx_block][trx_block bottom="10"][trx_icon icon="icon-wine-1" color="#b4bc5d" font_size="70px" align="left" bottom="20" right="30px"][vc_column_text]Our wine is a combination of hard work of our wine makers and the unique terroir; it's thoroughness on each stage of wine making and usage of up-to-date techniques.[/vc_column_text][/trx_block][trx_block][trx_icon icon="icon-bottle-3" color="#b4bc5d" font_size="70px" align="left" bottom="20" right="30px"][vc_column_text]In our wine racks you will find a vast selection of different wines from the four corners of the globe. Our friendly and experienced staff will help you to find that ideal bottle.[/vc_column_text][/trx_block][/trx_column_item][trx_column_item][trx_image url="466"][/trx_column_item][/trx_columns][vc_empty_space height="85px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1444643906422{margin-bottom: -40px !important;}"][vc_column][vc_empty_space height="80px"][trx_team style="team-3" align="center" title="Our Team" subtitle="We transform ideas into solutions our clients can be proud of." cat="0" width="960px"][trx_team_item user="Member 1"][/trx_team_item][trx_team_item user="Member 2"][/trx_team_item][trx_team_item user="Member 4"][/trx_team_item][/trx_team][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Support
item.dc:creator: trx_admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1451299755045{background-color: #ffffff !important;}"][vc_column][trx_section top="100px" bottom="100px"][trx_title type="3" align="center" color="#000000" top="" bottom="30px" left="" right=""]Our Support Policy[/trx_title][trx_columns margins="" top="small"][trx_column_item][vc_column_text]
  • To get a pre-purchase advice, you may post in the theme's forum.
  • To get a response more promptly, you are recommended to use our Ticket-system.
  • We try to answer your questions within 1-10 hours. However, if any delay occurs, it doesn't mean that we forgot about you. Some of the issues require testing and analyzing, so that we could resolve it effectively.
[/vc_column_text][/trx_column_item][trx_column_item][vc_column_text]
  • Please note! We do not provide support, if you do not have the purchase code.
  • Item support does not include:
    1. Customization and installation.
    2. Support for third party software and plugins.
[/vc_column_text][/trx_column_item][/trx_columns][/trx_section][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" scheme="light"][vc_column][trx_section top="100px" bottom="100px"][trx_title type="3" align="center" color="#000000" top="" bottom="30px" left="" right=""]How to Use Our Support System[/trx_title][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1466153081889{margin-top: 25px !important;margin-bottom: 10px !important;}"]

ThemeRex technical support is always there to assist their users with all the technical questions regarding ThemeRex products.

[/vc_column_text][trx_columns margins="" top="tiny"][trx_column_item][trx_image url="1216"][/trx_column_item][trx_column_item][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1466153115756{margin-top: 20px !important;}"]
  1. In the Item Details there is a clickable banner Support Sys, which leads you to tickets.
  2. Or you may simply follow this link: themerex.ticksy.com.
  3. Enter your purchase key and register in the system.
  4. To avoid a confusion, please use your own ThemeForest login in Support System.
  5. Fill out the ticket form.
[/vc_column_text][/trx_column_item][/trx_columns][/trx_section][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1449069687256{background-color: #ffffff !important;}"][vc_column][trx_section top="100px" bottom="100px"][trx_title type="3" align="center" top="" bottom="30px" left="" right=""]How to Find a Purchase Key[/trx_title][trx_columns margins="" top="small"][trx_column_item][trx_image url="1217" top="tiny"][/trx_column_item][trx_column_item][vc_column_text]
  • Open the "downloads" tab in your account.
  • Find our theme in the list of products.
  • Click "download" button, and in the drop-down menu select "license certificate & purchase code".
[/vc_column_text][/trx_column_item][/trx_columns][/trx_section][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" scheme="light"][vc_column][trx_section top="100px" bottom="100px"][trx_title type="3" align="center" bottom="tiny"]Hosting[/trx_title][trx_title type="4" align="center" top="small" bottom="small"]Recommended hostings:[/trx_title][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1466153150129{margin-top: 30px !important;}"]

ThemeREX offers only the best products and services and recommends them to their customers. One of the most important services is HOSTING. Unlike any cheap hostings that usually have limited resources which causes many problems to the site owners, quality hosting gives a client a fair amount of resources sufficient for any website and any task. By using quality hosting you can rest assured that your site will work smoothly. If you happen to use such hosting with limited resources (e.g. GoDaddy!), you may experience issues with one-click install feature. In that case, you are always welcome to contact our support team to get qualified help.

[/vc_column_text][trx_columns margins=""][trx_column_item align="center"][trx_image url="1218" link="https://secure1.inmotionhosting.com/cgi-bin/gby/clickthru.cgi?id=themerex"][vc_column_text]

http://www.inmotionhosting.com

Get more than 30% discount on a hosting plan.

[/vc_column_text][/trx_column_item][trx_column_item align="center"][trx_image url="1215" link="https://mediatemple.net/"][vc_column_text]

item.title: 2000 VSJ Reserve Rosa of Syrah
item.dc:creator: trx_admin
item.content:encoded: The juice from most purple grapes is greenish-white; the red colour comes from anthocyan pigments (also called anthocyanins) present in the skin of the grape; exceptions are the relatively uncommon teinturier varieties, which produce a red colored juice. Much of the red-wine production process therefore involves extraction of colour and flavour components from the grape skin.
item.excerpt:encoded: Red wine is a type of wine made from dark-coloured (black) grape varieties. The actual colour of the wine can range from intense violet, typical of young wines, through to brick red for mature wines and brown for older red wines.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Good.

item.title: 2012 VSJ Sauvignon Blanc
item.dc:creator: trx_admin
item.content:encoded: The white grapes from which white wine is mainly produced are green or yellow of which there are many so that white wine can be produced anywhere that grapes can be grown. Some varieties are well-known such as the Chardonnay, Sauvignon, and Riesling. Others have a discrete existence hidden behind the name of a wine resulting from the assembly of several varieties. Tokay, Sherry, and Sauternes are examples of these. The winemaker can also use a variety with a coloured skin provided one is careful not to stain the wort during the separation of the pulp-juice. The Pinot noir, for example, is commonly used to produce champagne.
item.excerpt:encoded:
White wine is a wine whose color can be straw-yellow, yellow-green, or yellow-gold coloured.
It is produced by the alcoholic fermentation of the non-colored pulp of grapes which may have a white or black skin. It is treated so as to maintain a yellow transparent color in the final product.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Good.

item.title: 2000 VSJ Reserve Rosa of Syrah
item.dc:creator: trx_admin
item.content:encoded: The juice from most purple grapes is greenish-white; the red colour comes from anthocyan pigments (also called anthocyanins) present in the skin of the grape; exceptions are the relatively uncommon teinturier varieties, which produce a red colored juice. Much of the red-wine production process therefore involves extraction of colour and flavour components from the grape skin.
item.excerpt:encoded: Red wine is a type of wine made from dark-coloured (black) grape varieties. The actual colour of the wine can range from intense violet, typical of young wines, through to brick red for mature wines and brown for older red wines.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Good.

item.title: 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon
item.dc:creator: trx_admin
item.content:encoded: The white grapes from which white wine is mainly produced are green or yellow of which there are many so that white wine can be produced anywhere that grapes can be grown. Some varieties are well-known such as the Chardonnay, Sauvignon, and Riesling. Others have a discrete existence hidden behind the name of a wine resulting from the assembly of several varieties. Tokay, Sherry, and Sauternes are examples of these. The winemaker can also use a variety with a coloured skin provided one is careful not to stain the wort during the separation of the pulp-juice. The Pinot noir, for example, is commonly used to produce champagne.
item.excerpt:encoded:
White wine is a wine whose color can be straw-yellow, yellow-green, or yellow-gold coloured.
It is produced by the alcoholic fermentation of the non-colored pulp of grapes which may have a white or black skin. It is treated so as to maintain a yellow transparent color in the final product.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Good.
